headline: How to Cook Trout
description: This fresh trout recipe is seasoned, broiled, and served with the simplest butter-lemon sauce for a weeknight meal that couldn't be easier or quicker.

video.description: See the best, most delicious, and simplest way to cook trout.
video.name: How to Cook Trout

name: How to Cook Trout
recipeIngredient: 2 (8 ounce) whole trout, butterflied and deboned
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat until butter smells toasted and is golden brown, about 1 minute. Turn off heat.

Line a baking sheet with a piece of aluminum foil. Place trout onto foil; open trout so skin sides are down. Drizzle each trout with about 1/2 teaspoon melted butter. Generously season with salt and black pepper.
Move an oven rack to 5 or 6 inches below the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler on high heat.
Broil trout until opaque and barely firm to the touch, 2 or 3 minutes. Remove from oven.
Return pan of remaining melted butter over high heat; stir in lemon juice and parsley. Bring butter sauce to a boil; whisk to combine.
Serve trout on plates and drizzle with butter sauce.

review.reviewBody: No changes. Great recipe. Loved it. Had to cook it 6 min in Alberta Canada. Could be due to altitude. Thanks very much. Plus I love the recipe name TROUT!!
Fantastic! So simple to make! My wife and I loved it!
Easy and delicious, first try!

Incredible flavor from just a few simple ingredients. Perfection! 
Thank you

Nothing wrong with the recipe. I'm forced to eat trout along with other "oily" fish while eating for my blood type. I just don't like trout, salmon, mackerel none of the required fish. I don't like the texture of trout. I'm no help other than to say the recipe itself is fine. If you like trout you should love the recipe.
Terrific recipe! Simple and easy to follow, quick to prepare, easy clean-up afterwards. The result: a delicious and attractively presented dish. Doesn't get any better than that.
Wonderful and so simple. I can’t wait to try it on the grill next time!

Chef John, I have made so many of your recipes and have yet to be disappointed. This recipe is so simple and very delicious. I made it with the Kale, Quinoa, and Avocado Salad w/Lemon Dijon Vinaigrette recipe which was also perfect (doing review next). Thanks again for a recipe very well done!
The cooking time and temp worked perfectly. However, the fish ended up too buttery and wet. I’ll blacken the trout next time.
So simple, and so delicious! I steamed some vegetables and then tossed them in the pan with the remaining seasoned butter for a delectable side.

Made it as the recipe specified. First time eating Steelhead trout and loved how this tasted. Had a thicker cut so it took longer to cook to 145. Very easy to make and quick. Adding this to our fish dinner rotation.
Perfectly simple & delicious as written!
I didn't have fresh parsley, so I used fresh chives and fresh oregano. It was great!
No changes. Its so simple and was delicious!
Delicious and easy. I'll make it again!

This was easy, quick, and delicious. I made it with freshly caught steelhead trout, fresh lemon, and dried parsley. Getting the butter to brown lightly is key! Thank you Chef John for another wonderful recipe! I'll make this again!
Turned out yummy! Recommend this recipe. Easy to cook. I did not have a butterflied fish, just used the recipe on a whole fish and it worked out fine.

It turned out okay. I made the recipe accordingly but I should have adjusted the amount due to I only had two trouts filet and not two whole trouts. It was a little bit to much lemon juice. I will definitely try and remake this dish. I will half the ingredients. Also I tried what the lady suggested about the skin, it did not work.
Very good will make it again
This is my go to recipe for trout from now on. Easy pizie and oh so good!
So simple and delicious! Don't change a thing

I am not very good in the kitchen and have never made trout before. This recipe is so easy and it was good!! I added oregano and rosemary to season the fillets before cooking. I also added garlic to the butter sauce. I think next time I will add more lemon - just my taste preference. Instead of baking, I wrapped in foil and grilled 3-5min each side.
This was so easy and we loved it.
Incredibly simple, yet delightfully tasty!
It was perfect. Thank you!

This is very fast and easy to make with good lemon and butter flavor. I normally like my fish breaded and fried, but this is a more heathier way to go. I’ll save the fried fish for camping when anything goes and the delicious healthy version for home. Thank you for this simple yet tasty recipe.
Delicious! Thank you so much!
made with all purpose Greek seasoning instead of salt. Excellent!
made with all purpose Greek seasoning instead of salt. Excellent!

We had a 2lb fillet so it required more than double the cooking time but the fish was perfect and not super fishy tasting. Chef John never steers is wrong. We will definitely be trying this on other fish as well as trout again.

Amazing recipe! And amazingly simple. The only thing to watch out for is over-cooking the parsley—add it to the butter sauce immediately before serving. If you add it at end and then let the sauce sit, it will wilt and turn brown. Consider sprinkling the parsley raw over the fish at the end, then pour the sauce over it to avoid over-cooking....
Pretty good and I don’t like fresh water fish.
No substitutions. Simply delicious as is.
I didn't make substitutions, but next time I would cut back on the amount of butter for the sauce by at least half, to 1/4 cup or even 1/8th cup.
Excellent. Rainbow trout doesn’t need much because it’s already delicious, so this was a perfect little light marinade.
will make again, but now will try some other trout recipes too!
It was so tasty, and so very easy! I had to broil it about 5 minutes; all ovens are different. I’ll definitely make it again and again!
super simple and delicioius. ove r cooked the trout but still good
I made it as directed. It was really easy and turned out perfectly. My husband likes it so much he says he'll start fishing again.

A-mazing. And I understand why Chef just calls it "trout." I never want to eat trout any other way. We live in an area where dear husband catches a fair amount.... and this is our favorite recipe. When we have leftovers.... we make fish tacos. The browned butter sauce is key!
Surprisingly good, I’ve had so little luck preparing fish in the past, this recipe is a keeper. Thank you!
It was great. We cooked for an extra minute & it was perfect!
Super easy and delicious!!
So simple yet so good. My husband asked me three times about the recipe. I thought I was cooking salmon due to its bright color but it was Steelhead. Thank you Chef John
Thanks to Chef John. The cooking techniques make the difference. Another ten star dish.
Excellent recipe! My hubby and 2 year old son are VERY picky eaters. They both cleaned their plates and asked for seconds! I used flounder (only fish on hand). A definite keeper!

After melting the butter, I seasoned with salt and pepper and a couple teaspoons lemon, and dipped/flipped the fish before adding crushed Saltines to the top, fresh ground pepper and some parsley. My family said it was the best trout I ever made!

wonderful and simple. I didn't bother with the sauce I just threw the ingredients together and broiled as instructed. turned out so delicious and moist and flavorful even with just a few ingredients. will do this with trout filets from now on
Almost cried this was so good, great recipe, Definitely my new go to for trout.

I really liked this recipe and will make it again. My family is not found of fish but said it was good but too much lemon. Could've been my fault since I eye ball a lot of measurements. I thought it was wonderful. Very easy. Love the browned butter.
Delicious - cut the butter in half, added double lemon and a sprig of Rosemary on each side. This is a great recipe and it was so easy!
Perfect! I’ve drizzled butter and lemon juice on trout before, but for some reason preparing a sauce this way is way better! So good!
Delicious!

This is a delicious dish. The ingredients are simple, fresh, and bursting with flavor. There were no changes made to this recipe except to substitute steelhead trout for rainbow trout. Thank you Chef John. I no longer fear making fish.
I've never made trout before. Recipe was super easy to follow and the results were yummy!!

This will definitely be my go-to recipe for trout. It was so good! Taking the time to brown the butter is time very well spent. I skipped this step the first time I made this, but now I know better. Do not skip any steps!
Easy and delicious - the whole family loved it and are asking me to send them the link. We didn't have any parsley, so we chopped up fresh basil instead. Amazing.
So easy and yummy!
This so delicious. Made just as the recipe called for. This is going in my rotation for sure.
Super easy and really tasty!
Excellent! Will use this recipe again!
Very easy fish dish. I had a thick filet of trout and it needed more than 10 minutes under the broiler. The butter /lemon sauce added a fresh lemony flavor to the fish.

Very nice! After watching the video, I think I browned the butter too much, but it was still delightful. The balance of the butter and the fresh squeezed lemon juice and the freshly picked parsley was wonderful. Instead of salt and pepper we used a salt free lemon pepper. We used a 1.5 pound rainbow trout fillet, so it ended up taking about 10 minutes to cook. We will be making this again.
So easy and so GOOD!
very good and so easy to make

Simple & delicious. I used fresh Meyers lemon, parsley and added a little dill. I finally learned to dry then dust the skin with flour before putting it in the hot butter. That's how you get the crunchy crust. Basic thing but I always rinsed the fish off and threw it in the pan. Just adding that little pat to dry the skin made all the difference.
Fantastic! And one of the quickest meals I've ever made. Will make again...frequently.
yummy! simple to make bit melts in your mouth!
Amazing and simple:)
Awesome. I used thyme instead of parsley, excellent. Thank you
Made it exactly as written, perfect, delicious and simple.
Definatley an easy weekday meal. Would recommend to anyone and everyone. 4 star is only because I like a bold flavour.. this is mild tasting. My family loves it..
Simple and delicious.
Easy! Everybody thought I bought it!
Sometimes the simplest things in life are the best!!
I did not make any changes nor will I. I do not cook fish very often but with recipes like this I probably will do. Very flaky and cooked perfectly with these directions and ingredients. We loved it.
Easy, light and quick week night meal! I will put this one in my rotation
Absolutely delicious and simple, which makes me very happy. Get tired of recipes that take me 45 minutes to make. My four year old's new favorite dish!

Outstanding and simple recipe! Was out of fresh parsley so had to use dried which worked just fine in a pinch. With a mild fish such as trout, simple ingredients work best. Aside from trout amondine, this will be my go to recipe for trout from now on.
Delicious! Followed the recipe exactly - perfect the way it is. Will definitely make this again!!

Used fresh skinned and deboned Norh Carolina Mountain trout pieces, as well as dried parsley and dried dill and bottled Lemon juice (because that's what we had on hand) and it was excellent for both the regular trout eater and the non-regular trout eater. Incredibly easy and tasty! This recipe is a keeper.
Simple, delicious, tasty, and fresh. Life doesn't get much better than this recipe for fish. You can cook other types of fish this way as well. Good, easy recipe!

I didn't change a thing- delicious! The brown butter and parsley made this dish sing. Important to S n P well. Made with trout caught just yesterday. Fresh, simple, healthy, yet very satisfying to the taste buds. Only way I'll ever cook trout again. Thanks, Chef!
I sauted fresh spinach leaves in the butter and added it as a garnish. it turned out great!
I just made this. It was amazing and super easy. I didn't change a thing!!!
Nailed it! Excellent instructions as usual Chef John! Now that I know "how" I can be more adventurous with the seasonings...
easy and tasty. I had to cook 6 to 8 minutes. my fish must have been thicker. I used lime and cilantro to go better with the Pico de gallo/avocado salad I made.

If I need a recipe I always check Chef John first- his recipes are always fantastic. I had never cooked trout, and rarely cook fish so this was the perfect recipe to start out with. So quick, easy and brought out the natural flavor of the fish without anything else getting in the way.
easy to make and delicious
Fantastic! I've made trout many times, this is the best recipe hands down!
Very tasty, very easy. Next time I think I will have hubby remove the skin though or buy trout fillets.
Easy and delicious! Perfect combination!

The first time I made trout I used this recipe and haven't looked for another. It's so simple and flavorful that it makes the perfect bite! I add a few chopped capers sometimes for a little extra to complement the lemon.
Mangled the trout when I tried to fillet it but this recipe rocked non the less.

This is a great recipe for those who consider themselves cooking challenged. There were only 5 ingredients and they are things you typically have at all times. I typically burn everything that has to be broiled but the 5-6 inch setting helped me not smoke up the kitchen. It was delicious, simple and looked beautiful next to a nice salad.
This recipe is fantastic. I added just a splash of white wine to the sauce, but otherwise made the recipe as is. So good, and so easy!

I can't get enough. We make this once a week! It is simple, quick and delicious! The only change we make is we use cilantro instead of parsley just because we love cilantro. I have come to the conclusion, after using many recipes on this site, that if it is a recipe submitted by Chef John recipe, it is going to be amaaaaazzzing!! Thanks so much for another winner Chef John!!
Good for more than simply trout.
This may be the only way I ever eat trout again!
